definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide

sentences.english: In short, his good-luck charms seem to be working.
sentences.chinese: 簡而言之，他的幸運護身符看來起作用了。

sentences.english: She takes the crystal as her amulet.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎貝爾我是來取招魂護身符的。

sentences.english: Isabel I have come for the Amulet of Necromancy.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎貝爾我是來取招魂護身符的。

sentences.english: Markal will have the way to capture Hikm and return the Amulet .
sentences.chinese: 馬卡爾必須設法佔領希金，奪回護身符。

sentences.english: Say, Captain Borgen, do you think that it could have something to do with the amulet?
sentences.chinese: 博根隊長你認爲這跟護身符有什麼關係嗎？

sentences.english: I have come for the Amulet of Necromancy .
sentences.chinese: 我是來取招魂護身符的。

sentences.english: This suggests phylacteries, implements worn by Orthodox Jews during their morning prayers.
sentences.chinese: 這有點像正統猶太教徒在早晨祈禱時配帶的護身符。

sentences.english: Politicians show up to receive amulets for good luck at the polls.
sentences.chinese: 政客會來此求得護身符以期在選舉中獲得更多選票。

sentences.english: Laung Phor Chaeng applied this talisman to magic powder of fortune and the powder was blended in his amulets as well.
sentences.chinese: 龍婆清把這類奇異的護身符運同時應用到他的佛牌上。

sentences.english: He is represented on ancient amulets, with a whip in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他是代表古代護身符，以鞭在他手中。

sentences.english: Malachite was used as a children's talisman to ward off danger and illness.
sentences.chinese: 孔雀石被用作兒童的護身符，以抵禦危險和疾病。

sentences.english: Books are not seldom talismans and spells.
sentences.chinese: 書籍經常是護身符和咒語。

sentences.english: Rabbit feet as talismans may hark back to early Celtic tribes in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 兔爪作爲護身符可以追溯到英國早期的凱爾特部落。

sentences.english: Say, captain borgen, do you think that it could have something to do with the amulet.
sentences.chinese: 博根隊長你認爲這跟護身符有什麼關係嗎？

sentences.english: They would decapitate their enemies and keep them as talismans .
sentences.chinese: 他們將自己的敵人殺頭，留得住作爲護身符。

definition: to wear (as accessories)/carry at the waist
taboo/to avoid as taboo/to abstain from
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
